mods.note: 4 o § BRITISH CONSULATE MUSCAT PILE NO: 9/6 NAME OF PILE: NAVAL & SHIPPING: SURVEY OP KURIA MURIA ISLAND & UM AL QUWAIN M v% Telegram- From Resident, Bushire To Political, Buscat Ho.180 Batea Sc received 11th March 1931. rlease rejjly urgent if Muscat Council have any objection to survey jjarty from 'Ormande' landing on mainland in vicinity of Kuria Muria Bay, probably towards the end of larch to taiie observations. Addressed Govt.of India xiepeated Bushire 871. *ITelegram - l. From, irolitical, 2mscat To Resident, Bushire Dated 12th .^arch 1931 Tour telegram Do.180. .as Daid 2aid ia on tour I have SHKKMll&a. has jj^oached Sheiiih Duhair Vvho/consulted some individuals with knowledge of area concerned. Various tribes of Bedouin elements inhabit mainland! Liuscat has no control whatever over them; they do not acknowledge any one sheikh and they have the reputation of being lawless. tha t Zubair survey party would most probably meet with opposition. Prior consent of Arabs of mainland might though possibly* hsix/not certainly,be obtained by sending them influential messengers but this would take time* 7 Telegram From Resident, Bushire To Political, Muscat No, 197. Dated 17 th Reed 18th March 1931* With reference to Ormonde. Secretary of State's telegram 870.Mar: 10 . Council Muscat say mainland populated by Beduins entirely out of their control and acknowledging no single Sheik. They have a lawless reputation and a survey party would probably be met by opposition. If visit by the Ormonde is really important my suggestion is that the vessel should proceed there and if the inhabitants attitude is not hostile should land a survey party, but in no case go out of range of ship's guns. If the inhabitants are hostile in attitude party not to land. Addressed to the Govt of India, and^ — ^ ^Secretary of State for India 18? The above is repeated for your information.B. Telegram From To Repeated to No. 773-S V 4 v Government of India, Foreign & Political Department. New Delhi. Secretary of State for India. London. Political President, -BusMre. Dated 14th. received 15th. March 1931 Important. 1931. J? M Bushire telegram No. 167 dated March 13th. We agree with Resident. ADMIRALTY, S*W. 1. 11*0271/51# 18th March, 1931 Sir I am commanded by Uy Lords Commie a loners of the Admiralty to state, with reference to telegram No. 187 from the Political Resident, Perelan Gulf, (Your reference *1528/1931} that h.it.S^OKmONDS has heen informed that no lar;aing should Toe attempted in connection with the survey of Inorya iSorya Bay* 2* Copies of this letter have been sent to the foreign Oifice cjui Colonii-'l Office* I a.a, e tc • (Sd#) Char lee .Valler • The Under-Secrotary of State# INDIA OFFICiJ, 3* W* 1*

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 9/6 Naval & Shipping: Survey of Kuria Muria Island & Um Al Quwain'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order, from the front to the rear.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 8, these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: Correspondence concerning a proposal to land a survey party on the mainland of Oman in the vicinity of the Kuria Muria Islands. The papers cover the request for permission to make the landing and the advice that no such landing should be attempted due to the lawlessness of the area. The correspondence is between officials at the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf, the Political Agency in Muscat, the Government of India (Foreign and Political Department), and the Admiralty.

name.namePart: Government of India, Foreign and Political Department
